data.title: Senator Warren and the head of the U.S. OCC debate WLFI's application for a crypto bank.
data.description: U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren and Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC) Comptroller Jonathan Gould engaged in a heated debate at a Senate Banking Committee hearing regarding World Liberty Financial's (WLFI) application for a national trust banking license. Warren called the application the "most despicable" presidential corruption scandal, pointing to an investment firm linked to UAE National Security Advisor Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan investing $500 million in WLFI four days before Trump's inauguration, acquiring a 49% stake, of which approximately $187 million went to Trump family entities. Warren urged Gould to reject or suspend the review of the application, stating that approval would make it "an accomplice to corruption." Gould refused to intervene, stating that he would process the application according to standard procedures and countered that the only political pressure he felt came from Warren. Forty-one House Democrats had previously written to the Treasury Secretary, warning that approving the license could threaten "the legitimacy of the U.S. banking system and its independence from foreign actors." (Decrypt)

data.title: Binance Wallet will launch the Sentio (ST) Booster and Pre-TGE events today.
data.description: According to the official announcement, Binance Wallet will launch the Sentio (ST) Booster event on February 27th, with a total of 25 million ST tokens (2.5% of the total supply) airdropped in phases. The threshold for Phase 1 is 66 Alpha points, with a deduction of 5 points for participation, and the tokens may be locked. In the Pre-TGE event, each user can contribute a maximum of 3 BNB; ST will not be available for trading until the project unlocks its tokens.

data.title: Japan's January Housing Starts Show Slight Decline, Beating Expectations
data.description: Japan's housing market experienced a minor contraction in January, with new housing starts decreasing by 0.4% year-on-year. data.title: UniSat: Will continue to deepen its involvement in the Bitcoin mainnet ecosystem and advance the development of Ordinals, Runes, and BRC-20 infrastructure.
data.description: UniSat stated on social media that it is aware of recent changes in the Bitcoin ecosystem, but the team will continue to focus on the development of the Bitcoin mainnet and increase investment in Ordinals, Runes, and BRC-20 infrastructure. Specific measures include: implementing a 90-day zero-service-fee policy on the UniSat Marketplace starting March 1, 2026; expanding the scope of UniHexa early access invitations and improving on-chain exchange capabilities for BRC-20 and Runes; initiating technical discussions on a BRC-20 single-step transfer scheme; and upgrading the UniSat API to support the MCP architecture for commercial-grade on-chain data services. Furthermore, UniSat plans to purchase at least 500,000 FB tokens in phases to participate in the Fractal standard index service, which will launch in the second quarter, with the first phase of deployment expected to be completed within 15 days.

data.title: Bitcoin spot ETFs saw a total net inflow of $254 million yesterday, marking the third consecutive day of net inflows.
data.description: According to SoSoValue data, Bitcoin spot ETFs saw a total net inflow of $254 million yesterday (February 26th, Eastern Time). The BlackRock ETF (IBIT) saw the largest single-day net inflow of $276 million, bringing its historical total net inflow to $61.839 billion. The Bitwise ETF (BITB) followed with a net inflow of $69.0102 million, bringing its historical total net inflow to $2.173 billion. Conversely, the Fidelity ETF (FBTC) saw the largest single-day net outflow of $51.4874 million, bringing its historical total net inflow to $10.996 billion. As of press time, the total net asset value of Bitcoin spot ETFs is $85.937 billion, with an ETF net asset ratio (market capitalization as a percentage of Bitcoin's total market capitalization) of 6.38%, and a historical cumulative net inflow of $54.828 billion.
